sentences.en: As you know, it is our style to try to solicIt'suggestions from below.
sentences.cn: 如你所知, 我们的工作作风是设法鼓励下面提出建议.

sentences.en: Beggars are not allowed to solicit in public places.
sentences.cn: 乞丐不得在公共场所乞讨.

sentences.en: He had to solicit the assistance of Sir Nicholas Fitzwhiggin and Mr Towers.
sentences.cn: 他还不得不去要求尼古拉斯·菲茨惠金爵士和托尔斯先生给予他帮助.

sentences.en: It is illegal for public officials to solicit gifts or money in exchange for favors.
sentences.cn: 公务员通过索要礼物或钱财作为为他人提供便利的交换是违法的。

sentences.en: Journalists may not solicit advertisements in the name of news coverage.
sentences.cn: 新闻记者不得借采访名义招揽广告.

sentences.en: May I solicit your advice on a matter of some importance?
sentences.cn: 我有一件要事可以请教你吗?

sentences.en: Morgan is accused of illegally soliciting campaign contributions.
sentences.cn: 摩根被指控非法征募竞选捐款。

sentences.en: Prostitutes were forbidden to solicit on public roads and in public places.
sentences.cn: 禁止妓女在马路上和公共场所公然拉客。

sentences.en: Solicit a continuance of customer's patronage.
The Rushworths were the only addition to his own domestic circle which he could solicit.
sentences.cn: 他唯一想使他的家庭与之来往的是拉什沃兹一家人.

sentences.en: To solicit a judge means to offer him bribes.
sentences.cn: 引诱法官就是给予贿胳.

sentences.en: Walling and resting by turns , he wandered about until noon without the energy to solicit fares.
sentences.cn: 走一会儿,坐一会儿, 他始终懒得张罗买卖.

sentences.en: We respectfully solicit your continuous patronage.
We should often solicit opinions from the masses.
sentences.cn: 我们应该经常征求群众意见.

sentences.en: We solicit you for your favours.
World leaders also to the citizens through the Internet to solicit opinions!
sentences.cn: 世界政要也是要通过网络向公民征求意见的!

words.tran_cn: 律师；法务官；募捐者；掮客

trans.tran_cn: 请求给予（金钱、帮助等），征求(意见)，(妓女)拉客
trans.tran_en: to ask someone for money, help, or information
